website_summaries.verdict: An attractively designed, tip-resistant bowl that does the job of holding water or food. The anti-slip ring could be better secured, however.
pros: Wide base discourages tipping, and rubber-lined base prevents bowl from being slid around easily
Easy to clean by hand or  in the dishwasher
cons: Reports of rubber strip around bottom coming off after a few weeks of use
Pitbulls think the rubber ring is delicious
Flared base takes up extra room
Metal can scratch when scrubbing clean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size and Non-Slip Too
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our 5 month old 35lb Shepherd Mix that we just adopted. Each bowl holds 4 cups. Rubber ring comes off for easy cleaning. They do not slide around on the floor and she has yet to tip one of these over! I'm so glad I decided to be patient and wait for shipping instead of buying overpriced and possibly inferior bowls elsewhere! These are a great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: ofgoodcheer

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, they're great!
customer_reviews.text: They look great and work great. Much better than our old steel bowls that would slide all over while our two dogs ate. The rubber on the bottom keeps them in place. Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bowl set for two cats
customer_reviews.text: We had issues with one of our cats tipping the water bowl over, along with moving the cat food bowl every day. The bowls were small with a worthless non skid material around the base. I found this bowl set and decided to give it a try. It has been a few months now and we have not had one instance of water on the floor. Neither one of the bowls have moved either. The bowls are large enough for both cat heads to fit in and eat or drink. The bowls clean up easily and match our stainless steel kitchen nicely. I am extremely happy with my purchase. I highly recommend this product. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: yellowsprings

customer_reviews.title: rusted after a month or so of use
customer_reviews.text: I leave water in it and refill it as needed. And occasionally clean it obviously. within a month or so I can see speckled of rust formed on the bottom. i would not drink out of it so my dog is not going to drink out of it either Stainless obviously doesn't rust unless it has inferior metals mixed into it. They are also pretty small for a bigger dog. My dog is 100lb and the bowl for either food or water is suited imo for a smaller dog, maybe like 50lb and under.
customer_reviews.author: taimoor qadir

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't sure of the size when reading reviews prior to purchasing. They're plenty big!
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews from people saying these bowls are smaller than they thought... and then I read some that said they were plenty big. Ordered these for my 50lb Queensland Heelers not really knowing what to expect but they are PLENTY big! I think maybe the people who wanted them bigger were using them as water bowls?! My dogs are fed twice a day and each feeding only fills about half of the bowl. I would def order these again.
customer_reviews.author: V. Beckett

customer_reviews.title: Solid bowls for my pup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my Bichon Frise. She's not a big dog, but I didn't want tiny bowls for her. They are a great size and have a good weight to them. They clean up easily and do not get pushed around the tile floor in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi N. Copher

customer_reviews.title: It's a dog bowl.
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly fine. The wide base prevents them from moving around on the floor and making a mess. They're dishwasher safe which is nice. They're probably too big if you have a toy breed however. I have a 20 lb mutt and I dog sit for an English bulldog the bowls work well for both dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Lo

customer_reviews.title: Two paws down
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bowls for their "anti tip" characteristics. I have an overly excited 4 legged giant at meal time every day and during his parade of feeding wonder, he always tips over his bowls with his ping pong paddle sized paws. I guess I'm going to have to glue the bowls to the floor. Well, we tried...
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Walker

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Simple stainless steel bowls. They sit firmly on the ground, without excessive sliding and they clean easily. I would definately buy again. My dog eats about 12 ounces of food a meal and it holds it easily with plenty of room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: Too large for my dogs, yet great quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed a dog bowl for my foster dog, and ordered this set for its price. They were MUCH bigger than expected. (As a plus, I can put more water out at a time for my dogs?) I like that the rubbered edge keeps the bowls from sliding, but I wish there was a spot for my fingers to lift the bowl. It's hard to slide your fingers under the rubbered bottom to lift it up and place it down again without spilling water. (Maybe that's just me...)
customer_reviews.author: Holly SatterlundTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I was not pleased with these dog bowls. The rubber ring around the bottom is not secured to the bowl as with other bowls I have seen at the store. The ring just slips over the ring on the bottom and liquid can get trapped inside which would encourage mold growth. If you remove the ring to wash and dry it is VERY difficult to get it back on. I purchased a better bowl elsewhere and will give these away.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have a habit of tipping over their bowls and causing me a large mess to clean. A week in and not a single tipover thus far. I am satisfied with this item. Edit : 2.5 years in, still not knocked over. Edit: almost 4 years and still using this.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Jae

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price and a Much better for the health of your pet!
customer_reviews.text: These Stainless Bowls are 100% over those plastic Bowls... Easier to clean and now I'm not worried about the bacteria the plastic ones seem to generate. If you own those plastic ones you know what I mean! JJr.
customer_reviews.author: JJStryyker

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresented product, not 11" x 3"
customer_reviews.text: According to the description, these bowls are 11" x 3". Here's the description. This item AmazonBasics Stainless Steel Pet Dog Water And Food Bowl - Set of 2, 11 x 3 Inches #1 Best Seller As you can see from my picture, the bowl is only 10". The description says it will hold 38 oz of food, the bowl on the left is my old bowl, I feed my dog 32 oz of food, good luck putting 38 oz in this misrepresented bowl. I'm getting tired of order cheap crap from China that isn't what you advertise it as. Fail!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Food Bowls!!!
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are very well made. The stainless steel is thick and doesn't make that thin tin sound that some cheap bowls make. I love that it comes with 2 of them. I use one for my 60 lb. german shepherd and one for my 24 lb. beagle. If you only have one dog the other bowl makes a great water bowl. These bowls stack easily inside one another for easy storage or travel. I am glad I chose this product. If this view was helpful please let me know by clicking on the helpful button. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: phillygrl

customer_reviews.title: Rust
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get a set at this price and they looked GREAT upon arrival. However I've only used these for 5 days now and already the dish I use for water is rusting! I am going to get in touch with Amazon. The photo doesnt do the rust justice, it just looks like dirt on my phone but I assure you its rust
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell P.

customer_reviews.title: Rusting!
customer_reviews.text: These bowls clearly are NOT made of stainless steel. I have 3 rust marks at the bottom of my dog's water dish. False advertisement and harmful to dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Andraea Theoharis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't tip over but it doesn't matter because water spills out of it with a tap
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it doesn't flip over. But if I fill the bowl more than half way (which I need to because I leave my dog alone for hours) all he needs to do is slightly hit the bowl with his paws and water spills out of it. Even when I try to move its location slightly, all I need to do is push it to the side a bit and water falls out from the other side (like when someone jumps in a small pool and the water raises on the opposite side).
customer_reviews.author: TRT

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of bowls!
customer_reviews.text: Set of two bowls for eleven dollars is a steal! These are easy to clean and nicely sized. We saw the same bowls at PetCo for ten dollars each. Our three-month old puppy is growing up fast - she eats crazy fast (as if she's never seen food before and is starving, which is obviously isn't!). So, she almost choked from eating her food too quickly. We may consider giving her food slowly or getting a slow feeder bowl for her food.
customer_reviews.author: SipsWithTips

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a great product at good price.
customer_reviews.text: Just received these and they look very good. The wide base should keep my lab pup from garret them off. The reviews on this item were generally very favorable with the only negative reviews being that the rubber ring came off. I proactively ran a bead of super glue inside the ring. We'll see if this works. Even if it doesn't secure the rubber ring (never underestimate the ability of a lab pup to destroy things ) they look like they will work out. If I can figure out how to do a follow-up I'll let you know.
customer_reviews.author: TulsaGentleman

customer_reviews.title: Stainless or NOT Stainless....That is the question??
customer_reviews.text: thought these would be great for my cat but within 3 days the bowl i used for the cats water had gotten a crusted ring around the mid edge of the bowl, so i washed the bowl and had a hard time getting that ring to go away, put more water in the bowl and in a day or so that ring was back, i question if these are “True” stainless steel or not?
customer_reviews.author: ThePeanutButterKid

customer_reviews.title: They will not tip!
customer_reviews.text: My dog was constantly tipping our bowls so we went to petco and bought some that said they were not tipable. She began to find ways to tip those as well. I became frustrated so I decided to check out amazon reviews. This was one of Amazon’s brands so usually the reviews are geared to say it’s a good product. At first I thought the price reflected one bowl but after I saw that it was two bowls I decided to purchase it. She has yet to tip the bowls and it’s a relief to not come home to a mess. The bowls are larger than I thought they would be, but there’s nothing wrong with that.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Cornes

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews you might want to invest in a more expensive dog bowl.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these dog bowls because of past reviews. They are not that heavy. But do not side across floor but I do have a Maltese. Water spots any spots stay on bowls I have had stainless steel bowls before and not had this problem. Also scratched very easy and I use a non abrasive sponge.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality but functional
customer_reviews.text: These are nice sized bowls and are functional however we have had them for two weeks and the rubber strips around the bottom are coming off. The actual bowl is heavy duty and nice but the rubber does not stay in place well and has to be readjusted constantly. This is not a huge issue since we do not even need the non slip rubber because we use the bowls on carpet but if you are looking for a quality non-slip bowl this is not the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: These bowls were perfect for my pitties and boxer mix. They each have one for food and one for water. I like that they don’t slide around at all. They’re easy to clean and the dogs like them. Only complaint is they’re shiny in a way that they may look like there’s water in them when there’s not. I have to bend down to look closely to see if I need to fill it up.
customer_reviews.author: ShanaJustin

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but good size
customer_reviews.text: We needed SS bowls for our service pup in training (lab-sized). These bowls were a good price, and he hasn't been able to tip them over. He does like to try to eat the rubber off the rim of the bottom (textured like his kong), but he hasn't yet. However, the rubber doesn't really keep them from slipping. I think they mostly quiet them just a bit. The shape means he hasn't been able to grab them and carry them off anywhere/spill the water out by picking them up with his teeth or batting at it with his paw, unlike the resin ones we have for our other dog.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write this review, I wanted to see how they held up. I actually use one for dry food, one for water. They are great! They stay put (I have cats, but they have been known to move bowls). The one I use for water has not shown any signs of rust or oxidation. Plus no slime build up, which I've had in both plastic & ceramic bowls. I'd recommend them to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: GKK

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD FOR DESTRUCTIVE DOGGOS
customer_reviews.text: I liked how cheap these were and that they were stainless steel, which is good for cleaning. I did NOT like the rubber nonslip bottom. My dog tore the bottom off of them easily. I think this is dangerous because I don’t want my dog ingesting the rubber or whatever material they use. It doesn’t seem safe which is why I gave three stars instead of five. I left the room for two minutes and my dog had chewed off the bottom. Definitely watch your dog while the bowl is down and then put it up the second they’re done.
customer_reviews.author: Kacii The Kooky Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Not large
customer_reviews.text: These are not large. They barely hold 3 cups of dog food. I have large dogs and I can just get enough food in but it would work better for those who have medium sized dogs. They certainly wouldn't hold enough water for my dogs needs but I did buy them for food and I'm not thrilled with the amount they hold.
customer_reviews.author: GMM

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy. Only one piece of feedback
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are great for my 8 month old puppy. They stack on top of each other, so very nice for storage or traveling. They're stainless steel, so very easy to hand wash and keep clean. And, the fact that they provide 2 is a great deal! The only downside I have is with the rubber base. One of my bowls had a loose rubber base. The rubber ring on the bottom doesn't stay flush with the bowl, which leaves a gap that I'm worried may result in rust or mold in the crack. Other than that one minor quality issue, I think these bowls are great!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great bowls for my Lab with impaired mobility!!
customer_reviews.text: My lab has a hard time getting around sometimes, and with past water and food bowls would accidentally step and the lip and tip water or dog food all over the place. An obvious headache. I bought a set of these and they have worked flawlessly. I thoroughly cleaned them when they arrived, and i clean them deeply about every 2 weeks (1 dog uses both bowls, kept indoors) and they seem to be holding up just fine I highly recommend these over the really expensive ones my wife and I first looked at at major pet store chains.
customer_reviews.author: XR4TI

customer_reviews.title: Nice stainless steel bowl. not easy to tip over.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's a great bowl, just not what I thought I ordered. I misread the description and thought it said 88 oz, so I was thinking it was bigger than the one I already have, when it's actually quite small. Like the old one, it has a rubber ring around the bottom to keep it from slipping around which is great. We took it off of ours because we use a silicone mat to keep the water off the floor, and the ring just makes it harder to clean, adding little benefit for us. One good thing Is that it won't tip over easily
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs Redesign
customer_reviews.text: As a dog food dish it's fine. As a water dish it could stand some improvement... with the inside slope steep (an OK aspect) the break at the top should then flare out (and up) a bit before sloping back down the outside. As it is my dog, a prodigious and sloppy drinker, spills a great deal of water outside the bowl. This has necessitated my replacing the food/water tray under the two bowls with a boot tray that has steeper sides to contain the oversplash and prevent ruining my wood floors over time.
customer_reviews.author: Dwebson

customer_reviews.title: Makes the water look cloudy
customer_reviews.text: Just received the water bowl in the mail yesterday, shipped well. I washed the bowl three times. Each time the water appears cloudy. I don't know why, if it's the metal they used or if it's something else. None of my pets' other bowls have any issue like this but I didn't get those thru Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great Bowls for Price
customer_reviews.text: These were great bowls for the price! I was really worried that the metal would be so thin and light that there might not be enough weight to provide resistance for the anti-slip rubber on the bottom to be effective, but turned out not to be the case. They are nice heavy stainless steel bowls, and the anti-slip rubber really worked well at keeping the bowl in it's place. Dog no longer has to chase his food around as the bowl scoots across the floor.
customer_reviews.author: P. White

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and great value!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these bowls. They stay put, hold enough food and water for my 65-pound pitbull, clean up easily (I run mine through the dishwasher), stack together for packing, are lightweight but sturdy, and look nice. I have to fill up her water several times a day, but I dont mind because that means the water is fresh. These were a great purchase for a great price and I recommend them to anyone looking for dog bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these bowls now for almost two years and even with daily use, they still look and feel great. Before purchasing these, I use to buy generic cheap ones at the store every few months because they would tarnish, look faded, or just didn’t smell right. Ever since I purchased these bowls, I have yet to buy another pack. Fantastic product, great price, and long lasting. I would definitely recommend buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: By 4 months my borzoi puppy had outgrown his small set. These work great, good quality, easy to clean and disinfect, I don't fit them in my portable dishwasher much but the rubber edging doesn't get loose or anything. They look the same they did at first after over 4 months of heavy use (fed 5-6 times a day canned and dry). They stack for travel, I've occasionally put a cup of dry food in one and stacked the other on top for transport.
customer_reviews.author: J. BushTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Stainless dog bowls
customer_reviews.text: The price was very reasonable so I will keep them but their "footprint" is large. I understand that the large footprint makes the bowls very hard to tip and the rubber ring makes it hard for them to slide but they take up a lot of room. The stainless steel makes it easy to clean. These are good bowls...just not for my current needs.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie Mehrab

customer_reviews.title: Good Stainless Steel Bowls
customer_reviews.text: These work as intended. One has suffered abuse outside through extreme wind, rains, blizzards, freezes and has zero rust, or any real signs of wear. They are stable, don't tip over, easy to clean, dishwasher safe. I just wish I had purchased a larger size, for my growing large dog!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Great for short term situation.
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is growing so fast I knew I planned on getting a lifted bowl once she was bigger so I got these bowls for the beginning. They do the job and I like how they stack up makes it easy for traveling and I even can put her portions in the bowl and stack the other on top and it stays put. I am seeing a little rust color happening on the bottom on the water bowl. I also clean out the water bowl everyday so I could imagine that gets worse if you don't. Good for the price I'd say!
customer_reviews.author: T_Mama

customer_reviews.title: Nice bowl
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bowl for my cats. I do not have a dog but I needed a bowl that could not be tipped over. My cats love to push their water bowl around and tip it over so they have no water. They cannot tip over this bowl but they do push it around even though it has plastic on the bottom to keep it from sliding. They haven't been able to splash out all of the water so they are still able to drink.
customer_reviews.author: Capable

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and too lightweight
customer_reviews.text: If your dog likes to kick his bowl over, don’t buy these. The rubber ring on both of my bowls kept coming off and eventually broke. Now I don’t have any skid protectant rubber on these bowls and the bowls are extremely light so my dogs kick them all over. My IKEA set was way better quality and I never had this problem!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Still tipable for determined puppy-otherwise great!!
customer_reviews.text: Attractive and easy to clean, but a puppy can still tip these bowls and make a nice mess of water. The sides are not slanted enough in our case; he stands his paw on the outside of the dish and uses his other paw to pull the dish over his other paw. Best bet in this case is to get a bowl that is not movable in anyway without you disconnecting it. If your dog is not that determined then this is a great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price!
customer_reviews.text: Regular large size stainless steel dog bowls. Rubber bottoms. Dogs can still move them since they are lightweight. The BIG thing for me was the price for two large bowls. They are easy enough to travel w/ or just for extras at home. Like I said.... it was the price for two extra bowls for our German Shepard that I liked. Cheaper than any big box store! I actually just purchased another set to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Carla O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Not for extra large dogs
customer_reviews.text: Way too small for a large dog if you own a Mastiff or similar breed or if you have grazers. I have to send back and if there is one thing I dislike more than grocery shopping, it's returning an order from Amazon. This will be my first return. I'm sure it would work nicely for a dog under 60 lbs. But for my 120lb Dogo it's a no go. I don't want to give this product a bad rating because if I had a tiny dog I'd keep it. I gave it a 3.
customer_reviews.author: Nicci44

customer_reviews.title: Shows water spots easily and needs to be cleaned a lot
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are great if you have a dog that likes to tip over its water dish or carry the bowls around the house! However, they are very hard to keep clean. I am constantly cleaning them otherwise they are covered in water spots because of the stainless steel. I would almost rather have colored bowls that do not show the water marks as much. They are fairly light weight, but are slightly big to be taking around for traveling. I prefer a collapsible bowl for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Stainless steel is the best material for dog dishes. I've got some plastic ones that have become pitted and hard to clean. Note that the 32 ounces takes the bowl right up to the rim, so if you want some splash room, you may want the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kuhl

customer_reviews.title: The metal is thin and scratches easily. When I washed the bowls the scratchy side ...
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are mediocre. The metal is thin and scratches easily. When I washed the bowls the scratchy side of the sponge left swirl marks in the metal and the center of the bowl gives easily making me believe the metal is cheap, thin, or both.. One of my two bowls was delivered with black scratches in the metal. However, it functions as a food/water bowl and it looks decent for $10. Don't expect quality heavy duty bowls.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought these
customer_reviews.text: I was really undecided about this purchase before I bought them. I was worried their quality would be sub-par. Thankfully that is not the case. I am very pleased and my dog has not (yet) been able to tip it over. I will say they don't hold a ton of water and we have to fill it at least one time during the day. Also I don't think these would be good travel with only b/c they are not even close to being small.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for a feral cat outside a couple months ago. They are already rusting and the animals (raccoons) have removed the rubber bottom and taken it with them I guess. Now the dish slides around. Am just using one for a water dish and have bought something sturdier for the food. It is very thin metal, but if used inside it might last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty57

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dog bowls
customer_reviews.text: We always got the stainless bowls that were the inverted shape from these (narrower at the bottom, and more recently, I started using a fiestaware bowl just because I liked the look of it (still do that for the water dish), but my dog has become more clumsy, and I like the rubberized ring and stable design of this style of bowl. These are generously sized for my large dog and a good affordable price. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Mainiac

customer_reviews.title: Durable and large
customer_reviews.text: Love these bowls. I bought two for my dogs. I’ve owned them awhile and no issues. Some rust or lose the rubber but not these. I pit them in the dishwasher to clean. I have two large dogs weighing 65 and 80 pounds. This handles their food no problem with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly J

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy when these came. They are sturdy, durable and easy to clean. I have two VERY picky dogs so I have to do a lot of work to prepare their food every day. I hand wash these bowls every day and once a week put them through the dishwasher. They handle hot and cold temps like a dream and even act as a heat sync to pull heat off the freshly cooked food. I couldn't have expected better from triple the price.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Boggs

customer_reviews.title: These bowls are a great size but the rubber liner to keep from sliding ...
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are a great size but the rubber liner to keep from sliding accross my kitchen floor has popped off one and i cannot get it to stay on... so thats pretty disappointing but they are the size i wanted so i'll deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: ZoeyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Large, sturdy and easy to wash.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great basic bowl for food or water. The rubber on the bottom doesn't always keep the bowl in place. My dog ends up walking his bowl around the kitchen as he eats. It's a solid bowl at a good price point, so I will get a mat for it to sit on - that will solve the issue. I am going to order a second bowl for water. This is exactly as described. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: spaznchick

customer_reviews.title: The bowl is shallow which makes it easier for my ...
customer_reviews.text: The bowl is shallow which makes it easier for my bulldog to eat out of. He slopped a lot over the sides with the last bowl he had. This one is more compact and keeps all the food centered so it doesn't move around too much. My on e and only complaint woudl be that the rubber ring around the bottom is kind of tricky to get back on after removing for washing, but I haven't used another bowl that isn't the same way!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: One bowl came in good shape but the finish on the other bowl was ...
customer_reviews.text: One bowl came in good shape but the finish on the other bowl was pitted and uneven so the quality is inconsistent. I would recommend these for dry food and not for pet drinking water as the water seems to develop a slime mold (especially in the bowl I received with the pitted finish), even with consistent washing.
customer_reviews.author: tetar1

customer_reviews.title: So good for a naughty cat!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has this nasty habit of pushing her bowls around with her paws/claws so I thought I’d get this one with the underside being gripped. It’s worked SO GREAT!! Thank goodness too cause I was starting to lose hope in finding a unmoveable water bowl! Thank you! It also lasts a lot longer being bigger and for a dogs water consumption, so two for one!!
customer_reviews.author: Guinness Cosplay

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Gorgeous Bowels!
customer_reviews.text: Very beautiful sturdy bowels! These look nice in our kitchen and they don’t slide at all on our linoleum floors. They are standard size bowls for medium to large dogs! I highly reccomend these! These are the best priced high quality bowls you can get! I compared prices on other sites and they were more expensive for those even though these are the same high quality bowls as these are.
customer_reviews.author: AvairyK

customer_reviews.title: Dog can't tip it over easily
customer_reviews.text: I have a standard sized poodle puppy who is pretty high strung. She loves to haul off her food dishes and string food everywhere or tip the bowls over. She has been unable to tip these and can't get a grip on them with her mouth to haul them off. The size for food is perfect. If you were trying to use them for water, would not be large enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Durable and look nice
customer_reviews.text: These have held up great. Look nice and seem to be durable. Would purchase again but probably won't have to cause they will last a long time. The English mastiff eats about 3 cups of food per meal and this bowl holds that well. I am not sure you could do too much more though.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mcdermott

customer_reviews.title: Great bowls
customer_reviews.text: These bowls are great. They are simple (no decoration) and the rubber band keeps them in place. They were also much cheaper on Amazon than Petco. The only thing I don't like very much is that they seem pretty big (bigger than I imagined), so keep that in mind when you order. Otherwise, the material is nice and soft and they should work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: AGon

customer_reviews.title: THERE IS NO REASON TO PAY MORE!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted! Very well made and absolutely no complaints what so ever! When you open the box it looks like there’s only one, it’s just that these things are so well made that they stack very well! I bought 2 pairs of them (water outside and food and water inside. There no reason to pay any more for something else. The quality will not be any better than this! These are well made tough things!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great price, 2 great bowls!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set of bowls for my two dogs. I have one 40 pound hound and a 70 pound GSD. They eat 2x per day. These bowls hold all their food and can go through the dish washer. Stainless steel is sturdy and shiny! My younger dog will pickup his bowl and carry around. He can’t damage this bowl which is great. He cracked a plastic one on the tile.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: still slides around floor
customer_reviews.text: I got these hoping they would not slide around the kitchen floor, but the rubbery bottoms do not really help that at all. And the bowls themselves hold much less than smaller traditional plastic bowls, about 1/2 to 2/3 as much. So in the end, I went back to the plastic bowls and will find a non-skid covering to put on the kitchen floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bowls that don't slide or tip
customer_reviews.text: Just buy these. This is a great pair of dog bowls. I had been using plastic bowls for my german shepherd, but wanted something nicer that she couldn't slide around the wood floor. These are perfect. Just heavy enough and with a nice rubber on the base, they stay where I put them. I'm extremely happy with this purchase. Would be great if they made one size larger also.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great product, better price!
customer_reviews.text: These were so much cheaper for the exact same quality of dog bowl sold at my local pet store. Seriously, half the price of one of their stainless steel bowls and you get TWO! I love supporting my local pet store, but this was one thing I had to buy here. They are large enough to hold the food/water my labradoodle/goldendoodle mix dog needs and the design keeps him from spilling the contents all over the place. I also really like how the rubber around the bottom is removable for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Pederson

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat the price for the quality!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon does it again. Bowls similar to these at PetSmart and PetCo were nearly $20 for one. Here you can get the set for a little over half. When I saw the price, I grabbed them up....and the truth is they are fancy and non skid. My yellow Lab has a habit of carrying his bowl around like a security blanket and then we can never find it when it is dinner time. These aren't that easy for him to pick up so it kills two problems with one solution!
customer_reviews.author: April Sessoms

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy. Doesn't feel like cheap aluminum. Yes, it is stainless steel, but I have seen some products advertised as stainless steel that are flimsy. They go great with our kitchen stainless steel decor. They are a little large. Makes out puppy look out of place at this size, but he will grow into it. Love 'em.
customer_reviews.author: gary assassin

customer_reviews.title: Won’t tip over or slide on tile
customer_reviews.text: They don’t tip over. My wife and I foster a lot of puppies and they were constantly stepping in bowls and spilling food and water all over the place several times a day. These bowls don’t spill and puppies can’t pick them up and carry them around. Also, the removable rubber ring on the bottom keeps them from sliding on a tile floor.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Leigh Bily

customer_reviews.title: 32oz seems like a lot but for large dogs, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: 3.5 stars. Wish it was a bit bigger, probably should have checked the measurements more carefully. That was my mistake. These are great for small to medium. Our dog is categoriezed as a large dog, she's about 90 lbs or so. Fine for water and food but small. Rubber on the bottom come out pretty easily and are a bit of a pain to put back on. Helps with slippage so that is nice.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic bowls.
customer_reviews.text: I've used similar ones for ages now. The other couple I have had for 15+ years and the rubber bottoms had all but worn out. So it was time to replace them. These fit the bill. Large, easy to clean, just as expected. Only thing is they are a bit thinner than my old ones. No idea if they are like that at the pet stores or not now. Haven't really looked. But can not complain. Doing what they need to do.
customer_reviews.author: Bug

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: My little dogs would carry their old food bowls full of food all over the house. Stepping on dry dog food in the middle of the night is similar to stepping on a Lego. Not fun! These work great. The dogs can't carry them around and they stay on the floor where I put them. The stainless steel is very easy to clean. No more dog food in the living room!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bowl....
customer_reviews.text: This a great bowl...will probably last forever...only good for travel if you keep it level..not deep enough for water unless you have a small dog..mine is 9mos 62 lbs Shepherd mix. I feed her 3 times a day in measured amounts..I believe..a healthy slim (no ribs showing) dog is a healthy dog...that's why I use this smaller bowl...
customer_reviews.author: Not your Average Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great bowls, wish the rubber was attached
customer_reviews.text: These do the job, but if your dog is like ours, she's constantly trying to flip them. I thought the rubber was attached to the bowl, but it's not. She managed to get the rubber off once to flip her bowl and now she tries to get the rubber off all the time. They stay down as long as she doesn't get the ring off. Happy with the purchase, I wish the dog would just leave the dang things alone.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: These work fine & do not slide around but they can be a little difficult to pick up off the floor without spilling the contents. They are hard to get a hold of but I have fat sausage fingers. They are also smaller than I wanted. I kept them but ordered a different type of bowl that works better for cat water.
customer_reviews.author: OSUCOWBOYNTX

customer_reviews.title: ... for the price but the rubber feet come off easily and the capacity is quite low
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat for the price but the rubber feet come off easily and the capacity is quite low, relative to the overall size of the bowl. For food it's perfect but for water, not so much. It holds about 1/4 as much water as my other bowl which has the same footprint and height as this bowl. For larger dogs (mine is only 65lbs), this bowl gets emptied quick if used for water. It will not last half a day...
customer_reviews.author: Alex Ong

customer_reviews.title: Good product but
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars because while it has a somewhat flimsy rubber gasket along the bottom rim, they still slide easily when my dog eats out of them. Not worth sending them back but still not what I was looking for. Also a bit smaller than I wanted since he is 90# and growing, but that is on me for not knowing how big I needed lol
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Barker

customer_reviews.title: SS dawg bowls
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. Two dog bowls for my male Pointer rescue. The bowls are deep enough to provide daily food and water. Very nice stainless steel construction with non slip rubber bottom. For the price, you cant beat these super high quality dog bowls for your pet. My local pet store wanted twenty two dollars a piece for the exact same bowls. I saved enough money to treat myself to Outback for steak and lobster lol. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sturdy Simple Design
customer_reviews.text: My dog is still a puppy at 17" tall (shoulders) and 25 lbs. I love the size, the quality, the rubber grip lining. My dog loves to dig his little paws into his water bowl and this bowl has stood strong. They do not tip and it is not easy to pick up for my dog. They are clean sleek simple bowls that my dog enjoys using and they look good in the kitchen. The price for these bowls is unbeatable. Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla T.

customer_reviews.title: It's a dog bowl
customer_reviews.text: Basic bowl for your dog. Doesn't hold as much food as I thought it would. Rubber on the bottom edge looks great but it does still scoot across the floor when she is eating. Best part is the price and she can't chew on it. I have ordered another bowl for the pup as she eats too fast. I will be giving this one to my GSD as she has chewed up her crock bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good, my sons dog chewed off the rubber ring ...
customer_reviews.text: Not good, my sons dog chewed off the rubber ring around the bottom of the dishes the first day she was left alone , there was rubber pieces everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Perrone

customer_reviews.title: It’s a water bowl. It won’t cure terminal illness.
customer_reviews.text: I mean it holds water...I guess that should get five stars. Dog seems to like drinking from it, but he’s probably not a good reference since he’s also ok with drinking from the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Wallcough

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This would probably cost three times as much in a pet supply store. I use these for water bowls for my three cats, including outdoors. There has been no corrosion or any other problem so far. The base is wider than the bowl, so it is very stable. The bowl appears to be stamped, and it is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: David Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Also compatible with 2018 model Cats
customer_reviews.text: I know these are for dogs, but with a little effort they are compatible with Cat Firmware. I currently have these supporting 2, 2018 model cat and they are able to handle the job nicely. (FDYI really 5 stars for the easy of cleaning, very smooth, these bowls get no built up compared to my previous bowls that I had to scrub regularly. These are very smooth.)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good price, too light
customer_reviews.text: Good price, nice set. The well is not deep enough for water and the grip is not the best. The set moves around...especially with the water dish, it become a nuisance. Great for feeding dry food.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not stainless steel- wrong information
customer_reviews.text: the bowls are not steel. they have iron in them. I tested with my magnet. They get scratch easily and are very light and moves when my dog is eating food. not sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: KARAMVIR T.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than it looks.
customer_reviews.text: We thought this bowl was the same size as our old bowl. Nope. The inside, where the actual food goes is much smaller while the outside is about the same. If we used this bowl we'd have to feed our big dogs twice each time to fit the same amount of food that our old bowl fits. But, from the side this bowl looks just as big. Weird. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt.Slum

customer_reviews.title: Will not tip....
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs are getting old and cannot see very well any more, they were walking through their old dishes and knocking them over daily. Perfect solution, only downside is they are smaller than the dishes they were used to. Update 10-22-19 As stated before our dogs are old. One downside we have found since is the shape of the bowl. It is rounded at the bottom so when the dogs step in the dish they push food out of the sides. Their old bowls were flat on the bottom so this was never an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large base and smaller area for water
customer_reviews.text: We previously had a bowl that held more water while having a smaller "footprint"(diameter of the base). Note that the base fans out wider than the top of the bowl edges. With this wider base, I guess it does lead to less flipped-over bowls, both by your dog but also for the accidental/occasional step on the ledge of the bowl by people. But if you need for your dog to have lots of water at a time, note that this doesn't hold a ton of water.
customer_reviews.author: Will L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and clean!
customer_reviews.text: My dog enjoys eating out of these bowls. They dont rust quickly and have been put in the dish washer or washed by hand often. My dog enjoys pulling over her food bowl and eating off of the ground but it attracts ants. So with these bowls, it is a lot harder for her to knock over and she gives up and just eats out of the bowl. Less ants makes for a happier owner!
customer_reviews.author: Jacee Whatcott

customer_reviews.title: Great for my clumsy dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog has some neurological issues that impact his balance, resulting in spilled water bowls all the time. This bowl is making such a difference! He's taken to it right away and has no issues drinking from it. No more spills! Now I can have dry carpets without him dumping his bowl over.
customer_reviews.author: Shmoon

customer_reviews.title: Water bowl
customer_reviews.text: This has worked perfectly for the needs of my big dog who loves to carry her water dish all around the yard. The curved edges and the rubber bottom make it harder for her to dump it over and take off with it. As summer approaches, I'm looking forward to not having to play the where's the water dish game.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Water goes everywhere
customer_reviews.text: So, it’s hard to tell how much if this is from the bowl vs my dog- but water goes everywhere. We have to go behind her with a towel every time she drinks. I think it’s because of the shape but I haven’t tried a new bowl for comparison yet. Otherwise, it fires look nice and is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mia bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: Woof, Wag  - it holds food and water
customer_reviews.text: It worked for my 2 dogs that I fostered. Not really thick but it does what is should. Holds water or food. Like I get 2 of them. The black rubberish piece comes off easy but I can put it back on without a lot of hassle. would be nice if it were attached better.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Greenstreet

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: My dog was acting weird with his old bowl so I read that maybe it was moving on the floor and scaring him—and they suggested trying a rubber bottom bowl. I have to say it worked. He’s not scared of his bowl now though sometimes he still scares himself- but mostly cuz he farted and scared himself!
customer_reviews.author: Elgin

customer_reviews.title: does the job, great for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: I got these bowls when I switched to a raw diet for my dog as they are better for sanitary reasons than plastic. They held up to his aggressive eating and the rubber grip on the bottom kept the bowls from sliding around. They wash up nice and clean It's fine in the dishwasher, no issues. I would only deduct a half star because the rubber grip comes off sometimes when hand washing. Maybe from the soap getting in between it an the bowl. But otherwise a great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: JayCee

customer_reviews.title: Well crafted bowls that won't slide around
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a couple of solid, well constructed food bowls, and these do the trick. The material is reasonably strong, heavy, and thick. I suspect that heavy person could stand on these with no problem of bending or breaking. I did purchase another set of bowls where the metal was light and thin, so these are a welcome replacement. The bowls perform flawlessly, they stay where you put them. Can't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: Great Bowls
customer_reviews.text: these bowls are great. My 50lb pup gets the perfect amount of food and water per meal time in each. I like the non slip bottoms so the bowls stay put while she eats. She has not been tempted to pick these bowls up as she has in the past with plastic ones. A great set.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Stainless Steel Dog Bowl
product_meta.description: Size:SingleAmazonBasics brings you everyday items at a great value. An Amazon Brand.
feature_bullets: Durable stainless-steel food bowl for puppies, dogs, cats, or kittens
Holds up to 38 ounces; perfect for dry kibble, wet food, treats, or water
Rust resistant; offers a healthy alternative to plastic; doesn’t hold odors
No-tip design; rubber base protects floors and prevents bowl from sliding while your pet eats

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
